bullets.text: Trump's unproven Tylenol-autism claim sends Kenvue to record low; FDA to relabel leucovorin for autism, intensifying scrutiny of treatments and liabilities.
Supreme Court lets Trump fire FTC commissioner, weakening agency independence and potentially altering antitrust enforcement and merger policy.
Trump's $100,000 H-1B fee threatens U.S.-India tech talent pipeline; Nvidia and OpenAI warn of innovation and competitiveness risks.
Gold surges above $3,700 as major managers tout gold, silver, bitcoin; safe-haven demand rises amid policy uncertainty and prospective rate cuts.
Fed Governor Miran urges sharp cuts; Powell's comments watched as small-business hiring weakens, signaling slower growth.
Apple shares hit 2025 high on strong iPhone 17 demand, turning positive for the year and bolstering mega-cap leadership.
Pfizer to acquire Metsera for $7.3B, strengthening obesity-drug pipeline and intensifying GLP-1 competition.
TikTok deal drops U.S. 'golden share' and equity demands, easing direct control while security and divestment pressures persist.
Judge overturns Trump halt on Orsted's Revolution Wind; project to restart, reducing policy overhang for U.S. offshore wind.
Nvidia plans up to $100B investment in OpenAI alongside 10GW systems buildout, signaling an unprecedented AI infrastructure capex wave.
Multiple nations recognize Palestinian state at the U.N., challenging U.S./Israel position and reshaping regional diplomacy.
India commits $18B to chipmaking, targeting fabs and advanced packaging to capture supply-chain shifts and strategic tech autonomy.
Ransomware disrupts European airports; EU cyber agency confirms attack, highlighting critical-infrastructure vulnerabilities and economic spillover risks.
Childhood plastic exposure linked to obesity, infertility and asthma, implying long-run public health costs and regulatory pressure on plastics.
